summary: This bill reauthorizes the Foundation for America's Public Lands. It amends Section 122 of Public Law 115–31, changing the foundation's name, board member stipulations (expertise and representation), and prohibiting the use of funds for litigation or lobbying. It also dictates the availability and expenditure of gifts and bequests, directing them towards the Bureau of Land Management's multiple-use mission, and specifies funding of $10,000,000 per fiscal year for five years after the Act's enactment.
